name: Le Sirenuse Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in a standard view room for our honeymoon. It was gorgeous! We took a private car from Sorrento to Positano and the driver spoke highly of the hotel as he knew about it and its reputation. It did not disappoint. We were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and fruit by the wonderful staff upon arrival and were so comfortable in the room that we just sat on the balcony, drank wine and ate snacks the entire day! The same night we made reservations at the hotel restaurant and ordered the tasting menu with the suggested wine flight. It was the most delicious meal we ate in Italy. I cannot speak more highly about this hotel and we would not hesitate to refer our friends and family to stay here.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ONLY complaint I have is that sometimes in the evenings the rooms can smell of sewage if the winds are too strong. But if you let the staff know, they will switch your room and make sure you are comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved Le Sirenuse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Positano for our anniversary and loved the Sirenuse. It was a great location and the service is all that you could want.
reviews.title: Compared to il st pietro and palazzo murat
One of the best hotels anywhere
reviews.text: We flew into Rome and had a driver take us down to Positano which I would highly recommend - it is worth the added expense. It is nice not to have to stress about that drive and you really do not need a car once you are in Positano.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful. We stayed in one of the mid level rooms with a view which was great. I think you would definitely want to stay in a room with a view if possible. The rooms aren't huge but the views are great and the bathroom and room itself are very pretty.
reviews.title: Restaurant not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, it sure does, as John Steinbeck had put it in 1953 " Positano bites deep". The location of the Hotel Le Sirenuse is really good, not too far from the beach and not too near to be able to afford great views of Positano. You could even hear the lapping sea waves from the rooms! Our other choices here were Hotel Palazzo Murat (but too near the beach) and Hotel Poseidon (too far from the beach).
reviews.title: Positano's Le Sirenuse 'bites deep'

likes.liked: — The pool area, the great service and Positano views.
likes.disliked: — Room could have been a little bigger.

reviews.title: Close to perfect but a bit expensive
reviews.text: It is very very difficult to fault this wonderful, little charming hotel - from check in to check out, almost everything was a perfect 10 score. We had a 7th floor full seaview room, room number 80, right at the left hand corner of the hotel if you are standing on the beach and looking at Le Sirenuse. The location of the room meant the views from the room were not only spectacular, but it was very very quiet too as we only had one neighbour next to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious enough for a short stay (October 26), bed was comfy, bathroom even nicer with hollywood lights and a jacuzzi, Sony TV and Sony DVD player, ACE Daikin air-conditioning, small balcony with one table and 2 chairs, iPod etc. And yes, besides the standard Italian TV channels, there are at least 6-7 English channels. There is also Wifi throughout the hotel, but strangely, you would have to pay to access the internet.
reviews.title: Spectacular romantic, 5 star Dream!

likes.liked: — Location, fine dining, 5 star service! Romantic
likes.disliked: — Nothing, just a spectucular hotel in a breathtaking town!

reviews.title: Stunning views, nice rooms and warm service
reviews.text: Throughout the hotel, paintings of various types of animals were hung up and antique furnitures displayed wherever there is space, its really nice just to browse around. To me, the swimming pool area was the nicest part of the hotel, imagine you swimming alone in the pool and looking up at Positano and the sunset, the feeling is purely magical and sublime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is nicely lit up by some 400 candles from 8pm onwards. Had reserved a table by the window and was given a corner seat. The food, however, leaves much to be desired and were grossly overpriced - imagine a plate of cherry tomatoes alone, with absolutely nothing else is a whopping 20 euros! The Neopolitan rice cake, however, is quite good I must say. But with live music, and the ultra romantic atmosphere, paying 100 euros here for a simple dinner is quite alright, I guess.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every way!
Best hotel I've stayed in
reviews.text: We were really spolit here, this place is the hotel we judge all other hotels by and so far nowhere has come close.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fourth visit to Le Sirenuse in Positano and it never fails to impress us. The staff is top notch and everything is in perfect condition.
reviews.title: Friendly and Stunning Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beautiful room with a fairly large terrace overlooking the sea where we always spend quite a bit of time during the early morning and late afternoon hours. Breakfast is included in the price of the room and is one of the best we have encountered in Europe. Seating is always on the outdoor terrace, weather permitting and it's a perfect way to start the day. The staff is very efficient and always remembers your name after the first morning.
reviews.title: La Dolce Vita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you check in, you are asked if you wish a morning paper and which one and the breakfast staff delivers it to your table when you first sit down. I'm one of those weird people who doesn't drink coffee, but enjoys iced tea for breakfast, and after the first morning, I never have to ask again. It is always brought to me immediately. They also serve fresh cooked omelets, bacon and sausage if requested.
reviews.title: the best meal of my life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After June 1st, they take their beautiful wooden boat out of storage and offer free rides two times a week, (I believe). This hotel is simply the finest we have ever stayed in and I think we love it because of the personal touches you don't find in the big hotel chains.
reviews.title: Spectacular, stunning Le Sirenuse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually don't stay in hotels or B&B's anymore, as we enjoy apartments and the freedom they give, but Le Sirenuse just calls us back every so often. Everytime we leave, I dream about its beauty and hope that we may return again one day.
reviews.title: Best Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sirenuse in May 08. The property exudes great charm, is kept in a beautiful spotless condition, with lovely antique furniture. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is friendly and unpretentious.
reviews.title: Very beautiful and charming

likes.liked: — Beautiful property overall in a stunning setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym and spa are lovely and modern, there is free internet access.
reviews.title: Loved the Sirenuse in Positano!

likes.disliked: — the small space around the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the terrace is a wonderful experience, a nice range of food, perfect service.
reviews.title: Amazing Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room with a lovely seaview was very expensive (well over 900 euros), but elegant, spacious and clean. Beautiful marble-clad bathroom with great Eau d'Italie products.
reviews.title: Summer in Winter at Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner one evening at the restaurant, which has a lovely atmosphere with lots of candles. The food was average, not very memorable and the live music was charming for a while, but became a bit too much for the whole evening.
reviews.title: Go, for an Italian dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a place to propose . . . and she said "yes" - of course! How could she not!
reviews.title: Romance at it's finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay at the hotel. The room was beautiful and the view was breathtaking morning, evening and night.
reviews.title: Yes - it´s expensive, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were serenaded at dinner and it was the perfect moment for dropping to my knee to present the ring and ask for her hand . . .
reviews.title: Overhyped, overpriced and maybe past it's best time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course we would return again . . . for the memory . . . but also for the hotel, view, staff, pool and restaurant - both dinner and breakfast!
reviews.title: Just Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I´ve never experienced a better hotel, overall. Service is impeccable. My husband said that they know what he wanted to ask before he did. Our room (we had a Deluxe superior Sea view) was newly refurbished and really stylish without loosing the special "Amalfi"-style. The oyster bar is great (don´t drink champagne there - it´s completely overpriced !) and the restaurant, too. We loved the SPA (therapists are fantastic). The hotel is providing a great range of activities (free of charge !), e.g. travelling with the hotel owned boat, and an informative brochure about places of interest. So once again: yes - it´s horribly expensive, but (besides the champagne) worth every cent !
reviews.title: The Best of the Least? A dissapointment
Positively Exquisite
reviews.text: Sometimes a hotel is just a place to rest your head on a trip, other times it can become a such a memorable portion of your vacation you can't imagine your trip without it. For us, Le Sirenuse fits the latter category. My husband had stayed here before and insisted we come back as a couple. He told me to book the least expensive room they had because you just "want to be part of that hotel." After going I can see why. Staying at Le Sirenuse is an experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: We booked a double room billed as "no sea view." But because there was a window, there WAS a view, albeit a small one, of beautiful Positano and a small peak of the sea. Of the 5 hotels we stayed in during this Italian trip, this room was the smallest, but somehow it also felt the most luxurious and well-appointed. A bed, a dresser (with silver service) a nice closet, full-length mirror, DVD player and free DVD library, CD player, and safe.
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful places!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: The moderate-sized bathroom had it all, including a tub with jet sprays. Of course, robes and slippers provided.
reviews.title: Horrible!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is an outstanding property both visually and because of its amenities and location but...there certainly are a few drawbacks. The staff with one exception was great. We had more than one encounter with a shockingly surly middle aged woman who ruled the front desk. Most requests (standard questions about touring/ transportation etc.) elicited a response that made you want to either shrink away or pull her across the desk WWF style. Anyhow, we chalked it up to tenure and then steered well clear of needing her "services". As for everyone else.. charming, friendly, and delightful. One of the Bartenders (a gentleman) even made us a CD of the exceptional music he was playing one night at the Champagne Bar. All of the Staff we spoke with were friendly and happily offered their tips about the area. We found a charming driver through the Hotel (Positano Car Service/"Michael") and he took us everywhere we wanted to go, helped us select restaurants in Naples etc. as well as shared his knowledge and love of the area. The --Hotel--food is wonderful and the Breakfast choices were abundant. The Breakfast Terrace which becomes the Dinner Terrace adjacent to the lemon tree and candle decked Dining Room provided an outstanding view of the coast. At night this same vantage point twinkled with the village below and the Dining Room filled with I don't know how many hundreds of candles took my breath away. The Pool is gorgeous and very recognizable but a little tight at full occupancy. The rooms are pretty but small as are the fairly standard bathrooms. The Hotel is in a great location although having to return there after a meal especially dinner near the water is a rough uphill trek. It's a must see must do but on all other trips to Positano we have stayed elsewhere and found wonderful experiences, much better appointed and larger rooms, and at a signifcantly lower price. Even though the view is killer and we enjoyed our time there I think once is enough...
reviews.title: Once (only once) in a lifetime

likes.disliked: — Small Guest Room and Bathroom, Pool was gorgeous but too many people for size of area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having heard from so many friends that the Amalfi coast was a must visit, we took the advise and planned a 4 night stay at the Family owned and run Le Serinuse. As often happens when advised by many friends one starts to build ones expectations and dreams of what the stay should be like - well let me tell you - not even our wildest dreams were anywhere near to what we experienced!!
reviews.title: A Truly Unique and Amazing Hotel ! ! !

likes.liked: — Impeccably maintained hotel, antique furniture and homely feel. Excellent location, fantastic bathroom ammenities, friendly and efficient staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were greeted as though we were long lost friends of the family arriving in their home. Everyone was so warm, friendly and welcoming and at the same time efficient.
reviews.title: Le Sirenuse--An Exceptional Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: Upon checking in and being escorted through corridors filled wtih antique furniture rendering a true sense of professional management combined with the personalised family touch - we opened our shutters to discover the most romantic view over Positano beach, the mountain and the top fo the church.
reviews.title: Good location but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evening Champagne cocktails are a must on the Oyster bar terrace so as to watch the sun set, and admire the beach below being packed up and put to bed ready for another busy day. How often back gorund music is either too loud, sets the wrong atmosphere or is just not audible - well here all i wanted to do was take the entire evenings music with me!!! Amazing selection with the best volumne .
reviews.title: Unbelieveably Serene

likes.liked: — Location, Service, Views, Food, We Loved It ALL!

reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, wonderful staff, great location
reviews.text: We celebrated our 25th Anniversary here in August 2006 and we were in heaven. Nothing was too much trouble for the wondeful staff, giuseppe and Daniel our waiters were sensational.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location is out of this world and we will be back!!
reviews.title: Expensive But Worth It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights at Le Sirenuse last week with friends. Absolutely fantastic hotel. We had booked partial sea view rooms and got rooms 22 and 23 which both had balconies with stunning views out to sea, with the vista only being partly obscured by the dome of the local church. Given that it costs an extra 250 euros per night for a full sea view I don't think the extra spend would be worthwhile.
reviews.title: Wow
Stunning and Romantic
reviews.text: Service was excellent but food and drink are expensive with a club sandwich through room service priced at 32 euros and most alcoholic drinks around 14 euros at the bar. After dark the setting is simply stunning with the terraces li by candlelight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My only complaint would be that the pool area is very small and the sunbeds are particularly close to each other- if you don't know the person in the sunbed nearest you when you lie down you certainly will when you rise from it!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
One of the best hotel experiences of my life and I travel 100 nites a year!!!
reviews.text: TA needs a six or seven star category for properties this perfect. Loved everything, not a fault exists. Had trouble deciding between here and San Pietro but chose this as beach did not seem as compelling in April. We visited the other property and it too seemed superb, but for different reasons: magical setting and unreal common areas. Sirenuse on other hand is in town and crazy easy to be a part of everything while still flying in our private lofty perch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room was lovely, but more compelling was view from our balcony that was identical to pictures from best travelogues. The breakfast is delicious. Th staff is my favorite anywhere, we felt like we were in our own private home, they helped pick where to visit and where to eat and understood us like they were family. Bath product pure fun. The pool patio is out of a movie set, hard to pull away from having one more coffee at breakfast and linger all day on the patio because it is heaven.....but then again Capri and the coastal drive are waiting!
reviews.title: Invitation to stay at Le Sirenuse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one spot on earth and one property I definitely want to return to. Magical few days this spring? Go!
reviews.title: Excellent luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Invitation to stay at Le Sirenuse,
reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Le Sirenuse, a wonderful stay in Positano, Italy. Our room was beautiful, loved the tile work in the room and thou out the property. Location can’t be beat and driving into Positano was surprisingly easy. No problem finding the hotel. The view from our room, pool area and restaurant are the same views shown on website, which are breath taking. Service within the hotel was friendly and we never had to ask for anything, as the service is top notch. I especially loved the La sponda Restaurant (Michelin rated) we had a wonderful dinner. La Sponda's food was amazing. It was an unexpected surprise!
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel
Amazing!!!!
reviews.text: The hotel itself is incredibly charming with many rooms throughout where you can sit yourself for a quiet moment. A trademark seems to be vines growing inside on many of the white archways and walls which give it a lovely-garden-like touch. That's where we ate an absolutely fabulous buffet breakfast (included) as we sat on this beautiful outdoor terrace overlooking the hills of Positano.

reviews.title: Standard Room Really Sub-Standard
reviews.text: The pool is beautiful with full bar service, there is another outdoor terrace where we sat in comfortable chairs, drank out of gorgeous hand-blown glasses, and watched the sunset until night showed off the twinking lights on the hill, the fireplace glowed, and the mood-setting music absolutely transported us. One of my favorite memories.

reviews.title: At These Prices Doesn't Quite Deserve 5*
reviews.text: It IS a very good hotel, but at these prices I expected even better.

reviews.title: Incredible experience
reviews.text: Firstly the good - a series of email enquiries were dealt with very promptly and efficiently, usually a good sign in my experience. The hotel and its public areas in particular were beautiful. Breakfast was a joy. We had a simple lunch in the hotel twice which we enjoyed. Positano is stunning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely but perhaps a little small (certainly by American standards), including the bathroom and balcony. Swimming pools in Positano are few and far between, simply as a result of the almost vertical layout of the town. Le Sirenuse has a beautiful pool, but space is at a premium and as a result the sun loungers are VERY cramped, and despite this there is still a shortage of loungers. They are also very uncomfortable. 10 euros for a small beer at the pool is also a bit of a joke. My other criticism relates to the one dinner we ate at La Sponda - expensive and very average. For fine dining I would recommend Max and for simple but delicious pizzas and pastas 'O Guarracino has a great location and is very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay, but not worth the price

likes.liked: — Location (Positano); views; cleanliness of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Finally if you're pushing the boat out a bit to stay at Le Sirenuse consider Hotel California which is literally a stone's throw away, slightly further up the hill on the other side of the road. We have stayed twice in the past. It is not as luxurious as Le Sirenuse but has a lot of charm and character and you will save yourself a lot of money. Also if you are planning on touring around the Amalfi coast Hotel Caruso in Ravello is worth a splurge (similar prices to Le Sirenuse).
reviews.title: An expensive hotel for what you get

description: Le Sirenuse is a charming family owned hotel located in the heart of Positano. Opened in 1951 by the Sersale family who converted their summer house into a hotel with 12 rooms. The hotel has grown since then with the acquisitions of two neighboring houses to 59 rooms and suites. Le Sirenuse today is still run and managed by the Sersale family who ensure the same atmosphere of warmth and intimacy remain, while breathtaking views of the Mediterranean and the village of Positano make this an unforgettable place to spend a holiday.
